title: Carol Kirkwood Announces Departure from BBC After 25+ Years
summary: Carol Kirkwood, a renowned weather presenter, has revealed that she will be leaving the BBC in April, concluding a career spanning over 25 years with the corporation. She made the announcement on the BBC Breakfast sofa, informing co-presenters Jon Kay and Sally Nugent that her decision is driven by a desire to spend more time with her husband, Steve. Kirkwood joined the BBC in 1998 and has been recognized with multiple awards, including being named best TV weather presenter at the Television and Radio Industries Club Awards nine times, with a streak from 2012 to 2017. Her departure marks the end of an era for a beloved figure in British broadcasting, highlighting her contributions to weather reporting and her emotional connection with audiences. The news underscores the personal sacrifices and career transitions that public figures often face, as Kirkwood prioritizes family over her long-standing professional role.
